meanings.definition: To deceive or swindle (someone) in a game of chance.
meanings.sent1: She buncoed her friend in the card game.
meanings.sent2: The con artist buncoed unsuspecting players at the casino.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat buncoed the mice during their game of hide and seek.
meanings.sent4: The cunning fox buncoed the rabbits out of their carrots.
meanings.sent5: The sly magician buncoed the audience with his disappearing act.

meanings.definition: To cheat or trick (someone) in a dishonest way.
meanings.sent1: He buncoed his way into getting free tickets to the concert.
meanings.sent2: The scammer buncoed innocent people out of their savings.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky raccoon buncoed the other animals out of their snacks.
meanings.sent4: The dishonest salesman buncoed customers into buying faulty products.
meanings.sent5: The crafty pirate buncoed the crew into following his treacherous orders.
